title: I DIDNT MEAN IT
body: ok so i was recently a dick in a ranked game and got placed in low priority queue for 5 games and i know i have anger issues sometimes so i served my time and when it came to the last game i decided to go back into ranked, i was so optimistic about this game and i even got mid and got to play my fav champ and i was AMPED for this game but also about three days ago i got gastroenteritis and ive been getting really bad cramps and other digestive system issues so right before the game got into the loading screen my stomach entered world war 3 and i had to blast off to the toilet and when i got back the game had already loaded but my team remaked the game and i got another 5 games in low priority queue and i didnt mean to afk so is there anyway this ban can be lifted/excused this time. rito i beg plz. i didnt mean it

replies.body:
Hey Acidalia,

I can understand that you didn't intend to leave the game.  

Sometimes when you gotta go, you gotta go.  And when you're in danger of spewing molten chocolate lava all over your chair I don't think anyone here at Riot would choose otherwise.

However with that said we've purposely designed the Leaverbuster system to not take intent into account.  This is because leaving, regardless of the reason still has a negative impact on all other players in the game.

One thing to keep in mind however, is that it won't take action on your account until repeated leaves have been recorded.  This is because sometimes life happens and we all need to leave unexpectedly.  You mentioned you had left  games prior so this is likely why the system was quick to take action on you for this one leave.

Also if you continue to leave games Leaverbuster will leave longer and longer punishments on you account. The GOOD news though is that your standing with Leaverbuster is not permanent.  It will improve as you play matches without leaving and eventually return you to neutral status.  This means that in the rare circumstance that "life calls" you'll likely be able to leave without facing a severe penalty quickly.
